about vendor

about 49th parallel coffee roasters & lucky’s doughnuts 


the idea was to keep it simple, and just make doughnuts the old fashioned way, no frozen product, nothing trucked in; just simple, delicious doughnuts and exceptional coffee. as a sub-brand of 49th parallel coffee roasters, lucky’s doughnuts has delighted the vancouver food scene with countless innovative and seasonal doughnut favourites.


our culinary team is up early, rolling out the dough and prepping each component. everything is made fresh, from scratch, no exceptions.  with the same focus and commitment to quality and sourcing as our coffee  program, you can taste the difference in a lucky’s doughnut.

aperitivo truck

drink flavours

#07 - the pistachio mustachio

available january 14 - 30, 2023
fresh-made pistachio milk* frothed into micro-foam and blended into our house chocolate sauce, then topped with pistachio whip and chocolate-dipped biscotti (can be made vegan.) 

served with a fresh baked, chocolate-dipped biscotti from italia bakery

*pistachio milk is made right on the truck using three simple ingredients: raw hulled pistachios, water and a dash of sea salt.


#08 - cioccolata calda mascarpone*

available february  1-14, 2023
house made dark chocolate sauce perfectly infused with a rich cream and crowned by a dollop of decadent mascarpone whip.

paired with a fresh baked, chocolate-dipped, chocolate biscotti from italia bakery 


*we travelled to torino, italy -  a chocolate lover's heaven - and sampled this authentic italian drinking chocolate. the mascarpone whip complements the drink beautifully, but also teeters this indulgence into dessert territory.

about vendor

aperitivo truck is a full-service mobile bar and café. the italian inspired menu is designed to cater to weddings, parties, film sets and festivals. 


custom built from a 1962 grumman step-van, the aperitivo truck is sure to turn heads! aperitivo serves a full espresso bar, cocktail, beer and wine bar and offers italian meat and cheese plates, fresh baked pastries and other aperitivo snacks. the mobile kitchen runs exclusively on a lithium battery power plant which is charged by the sun.

drink flavours

#15 -  purple dream

available january 14 - february 14, 2023
white chocolate and ube is made by mixing our filipino ube paste with michel cluziel elianza 33% ivory chocolate to create this unique hot chocolate.  we slow cook the ube until it becomes smooth with no clumps and then we melt it inside the hot chocolate  the drink will come with whipped cream on top if requested.

dark chocolate with amarena cherry is made by mixing our sweet and tart amarena cherries with michel cluziel 63% dark chocolate to create this unique hot chocolate drink. the drink will come with whipped cream on top if requested and an amarena cherry drizzle.

on the side: cannoli filled with dark chocolate sorbetto .


#17 -  picante chocolate

available january 14 - february 14, 2023
milk chocolate with tumeric, ginger & cayenne pepper is made by mixing our triple spice mix with michel cluziel 45% milk chocolate to create this unique hot chocolate drink.  the drink will come with whipped cream on top if requested.

 on the side: cannoli filled with madagascar vanilla gelato.

everbean cafe + just cakes bakeshop

drink flavours

#56 - 13 carat (carrot) 

available january 16 - 31, 2023  

join us in celebration of the 13th anniversary hot chocolate fest, as well as lunar new year of the rabbit, by toasting a cup of carrot hot chocolate for a good cheer! zimt vegan white chocolate is emulsified with puree of slow roasted carrot, hint of orange, a blend of warming spices, and creamy oat milk - we hope this gem of drink will give you 20/20 vision while launching into this new year all bright-eyed and bushy-tailed! 

what brings the bling, you ask? we are proud to present our sweet expert collaborator, just cakes bakeshop’s treat creation of an edible isomalt “diamond” set on a vegan carrot cake cushion all wrapped up in a clear jewel box.


#57 - what the puck?
available: february 1 - 14, 2023

inspired by the barista's daily work pulling shots of espresso, this thick and creamy vegan hot dark chocolate is infused with cascara (the fruit shells of coffee cherries) to bring forth a honey-floral-fruity note. it is served in an edible cup to resemble a double shot of espresso. (the edible cups are sourced from california-based amai company that produces vegan, gmo free edible cups made from upcycled grains and 100% natural ingredients.) 

nestled on the side is an edible caffeine-free “espresso puck”.

why puck?  well, each time an espresso shot is pulled, the extracted coffee puck gets knocked out into the compost bin. the puck, with its cake-like shape and chocolatey colour, always looks intriguing…almost good enough to eat. so what the puck, why not? let’s just do it! after sipping on the hot chocolate shot, you can not only eat the cup but also devour the chocolate vegan shortbread “espresso puck” created just for us by just cakes bakeshop.


note:  

 take home diy kits for both drinks will be available in limited quantities at the cafe, as well as at both locations of just cakes bakeshop: #5-7548 129 st. surrey (near scott road) and #103-17767 64 ave. surrey (cloverdale).

hours:  noon to 6 p.m., tues - sat/noon to 4 p.m., sunday.

about vendor

in hawaiian, ohana means "family", and honolulu coffee has been a proud member of vancouver’s ohana of locally owned bakeries and coffee shops since we brought our signature brand of aloha spirit to the city in 2016.


we are dedicated to bringing an authentic hawaiian coffee experience and laid back island atmosphere to our many friends and guests at our two cafes in downtown vancouver and kerrisdale and are firmly committed to supporting sustainability and the communities that we are proud to call home.


“farm-to-cup” is the core philosophy around which we have built our brand, and ‘local’ drives everything that we do. we are constantly adjusting our menus and recipes to showcase nearby suppliers and ingredients, and collaborate with our fellow businesses whenever possible to show our support for the local community. to that same end, we also strive to empower our team members at every turn and encourage them to keep developing their skills on both a professional and personal level.


it is an honour to be counted among the many talented cafes and baristas that are taking part in this annual festival, and we look forward to showing off our aloha spirit in every sip!
